name: Ref. Case Res. Elec. HVAC (FS)
_description: Represents switch to electric residential HVAC technologies with efficiency levels determined by a sales-weighted average of the efficiencies/costs of typical electric residential HVAC technologies currently (or soon to be) on the market, from AEO 2021

market_entry_year_source.notes: Assume historical measure penetration is captured in baseline

energy_efficiency_source.notes: Sales-weighted combinations of heating and cooling efficiencies for typical ASHPs, GSHPs, and electric resistance + central AC. ASHPs and central AC reflect min. standard to come into effect in 2023, represented in the 2030 column; all else is based on 2020. New/replacement sales numbers drawn from AEO microdata files, available from EIA upon request.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

installed_cost_source.notes: Sales-weighted combinations of heating installed costs for typical 2020 ASHPs, GSHPs, and electric resistance + central AC. ASHPs and central AC reflect min. standard to come into effect in 2023, represented in the 2030 column; all else is based on 2020. New/replacement sales numbers drawn from AEO microdata files, available from EIA upon request. For existing buildings, added service costs of $1K for switching from natural gas and $2K for distillate/other assigned based on EIA report, and added costs of $3K for new circuit breaker panel based on Redwood Energy report.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
Residential End Uses: Area 2: Incremental Installed Costs for Efficiency Upgrades
A Pocket Guide to All-Electric Retrofits of Single-Family Homes
source_data.author: Sean Armstrong, Emily Higbee, Dylan Anderson, Diane Bailey, Tom Kabat

product_lifetime_source.notes: Sales-weighted combinations of heating and cooling lifetime for typical 2020 ASHPs, GSHPs, and electric resistance + central AC. ASHPs and central AC reflect min. standard to come into effect in 2023, represented in the 2030 column; all else is based on 2020. New/replacement sales numbers drawn from AEO microdata files, available from EIA upon request.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

market_scaling_fractions_source.heating: Applies to all residential fuel-fired heating; no electric heating is switched by this ECM

cooling.title: RECS 2015 Microdata
cooling.fraction_derivation: Central AC multiple of 59.5% was determined as a proportion of total homes with a ducted cooling system where heating is done using any non-electric heating energy source. Total homes with ducted cooling in the sample is 76,090,522, and then filtered for homes with fuel-fired heating system (45,241,958).
